question: Tropical rain forests appear in which of the following regions?
option1: South America, South Africa and Central Europe
option2: Central America, parts of Australia, Guinea Coast
option3: Congo basin, Central America, South East Asia
option4: North and South of the Congo basin
answer: North and South of the Congo basin
explanation:
The Tropical Rainforest is a forest occurring in tropical areas of heavy rainfall. It is abundant with many species of wildlife and vegetation. Rain forests cover less than two percent of the Earth\'s surface.
The largest rainforests are in the Amazon River Basin (South America), the Congo River Basin (western Africa), and throughout much of Southeast Asia. Smaller rainforests are located in Central America, Madagascar, Australia and nearby islands, India, and other locations in the tropics.
